operatingSystems.name: KNULLI
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: SD card should be formatted as ext4 for best performance. KNULLI supports dual SD card setups.

operatingSystems.name: ROCKNIX
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Formerly known as JELOS fork. Uses ext4 by default for the STORAGE partition.

operatingSystems.name: ArkOS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Supports single and dual SD card setups. Second SD card can be exFAT.

operatingSystems.name: AmberELEC
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Continuation of EmuELEC for RG351 devices. STORAGE partition uses ext4.

operatingSystems.name: JELOS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Project discontinued - succeeded by ROCKNIX. Legacy support only.

operatingSystems.name: Batocera
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Supports internal storage, USB drives, and network shares. Very flexible filesystem support.

operatingSystems.name: RetroPie
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Primarily for Raspberry Pi. ROMs go in ~/RetroPie/roms/{platform}.

operatingSystems.name: Lakka
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Lightweight RetroArch-focused distro. ROMs stored in /storage/roms.

operatingSystems.name: Recalbox
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: User-friendly Linux distro. Share partition contains all user data.

operatingSystems.name: EmuELEC
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: For Amlogic-based devices. STORAGE partition uses ext4.

operatingSystems.name: GarlicOS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Designed for RG35XX. Uses FAT32 for maximum compatibility. Simple folder structure.

operatingSystems.name: MinUI
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Minimalist firmware. Uses FAT32. Very simple folder structure.

operatingSystems.name: OnionOS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: For Miyoo Mini devices. Uses FAT32. Excellent PortMaster support.

operatingSystems.name: Windows 10
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Full flexibility in folder structure. NTFS recommended for large files.

operatingSystems.name: Windows 11
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Full flexibility in folder structure. NTFS recommended for large files.

operatingSystems.name: macOS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: APFS is the default filesystem for modern macOS.

operatingSystems.name: SteamOS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: EmuDeck recommended for setup. Uses ~/Emulation folder structure.

operatingSystems.name: Android
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Scoped storage limitations on Android 11+. External SD card recommended for ROMs.

operatingSystems.name: Linux (Desktop)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Full flexibility in folder structure. ext4 recommended for best performance.

operatingSystems.name: Anbernic Stock (Linux â€“ RG35XX / XX family)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock firmware for Anbernic RG35XX series. ROM and BIOS paths vary by device - user must select paths during setup.

operatingSystems.name: Anbernic Stock (Linux â€“ RK3566 family)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock Linux firmware for Anbernic RK3566-based devices. ROM and BIOS paths vary - user must select paths during setup.

operatingSystems.name: Anbernic Stock (Android â€“ RK3566 family)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock Android firmware for Anbernic RK3566-based devices. Scoped storage limitations apply on Android 11+.

operatingSystems.name: Anbernic Stock (Android â€“ T618 family)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock Android firmware for Anbernic T618-based devices. Scoped storage limitations apply on Android 11+.

operatingSystems.name: Anbernic Stock (Android â€“ T820 family)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock Android firmware for Anbernic T820-based devices. Scoped storage limitations apply on Android 11+.

operatingSystems.name: Retroid Stock (Android â€“ modern devices)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock Android firmware for modern Retroid devices (Pocket 3+, Pocket 4, Flip, etc.). Scoped storage limitations apply.

operatingSystems.name: Retroid Stock (RetroidOS / Retroid Mode â€“ legacy)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Legacy Retroid Mode / RetroidOS for older devices (Pocket 2, Pocket 2+). ROMs typically in /games/download/.

operatingSystems.name: TrimUI Stock (Smart Pro / TrimUI OS)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock TrimUI OS for Smart Pro and similar devices. ROMs in /Roms, BIOS in /RetroArch/.retroarch/system.

operatingSystems.name: MagicX Stock (Linux â€“ Zero/XU family)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock Linux firmware for MagicX devices (Zero, XU family). ROM and BIOS paths vary - user must select paths during setup.

operatingSystems.name: Miyoo Stock (Linux â€“ Mini/Mini Plus family)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock firmware for Miyoo Mini and Mini Plus devices. FAT32 required. Most users prefer OnionOS CFW.

operatingSystems.name: PowKiddy Stock (Linux â€“ common firmwares)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock Linux firmware for PowKiddy devices. ROM and BIOS paths vary by device model - user must select paths during setup.

operatingSystems.name: PowKiddy Stock (Android â€“ common firmwares)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock Android firmware for PowKiddy devices. Scoped storage limitations apply on Android 11+.

operatingSystems.name: Data Frog Stock (SF2000)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Proprietary stock firmware for Data Frog SF2000. Uses ROMS/<core-name>/ folder structure. FAT32 only.

operatingSystems.name: M17 Stock (Handheld)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock firmware for M17 handheld. ROMs in /roms/, BIOS in /retroarch/system/.

operatingSystems.name: Game Kiddy Stock (Pixel II â€“ IUX firmware)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock IUX firmware for Game Kiddy Pixel II. ROM and BIOS paths vary - user must select paths during setup.

operatingSystems.name: GammaOS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Android 12 based CFW. Common on Anbernic and Retroid devices.

operatingSystems.name: GammaOS Next
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Android 13/14 based GammaOS successor. Improved performance and compatibility.

operatingSystems.name: GammaOS Core
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Android TV variant of GammaOS. Designed for TV box form factors.

operatingSystems.name: 351DROID
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Android-based CFW for RG351 devices.

operatingSystems.name: CrossMix OS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Linux CFW for TrimUI devices. Fork/alternative to stock TrimUI OS.

operatingSystems.name: FunKey-OS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Custom Linux OS for FunKey S device.

operatingSystems.name: OpenDingux
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Open source Linux firmware for Ingenic-based handhelds (RG300, RG350, etc.).

operatingSystems.name: RetroFW
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Lightweight Linux CFW for older JZ4760-based handhelds (RS-97, LDK, etc.).

operatingSystems.name: Clockwork OS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Linux-based OS for Clockwork Pi GameShell and DevTerm devices.

operatingSystems.name: Spruce
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Linux CFW for Miyoo devices. Alternative to OnionOS/MiyooCFW.

operatingSystems.name: NextUI
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Linux CFW focused on clean UI. Supports TrimUI and similar devices.

operatingSystems.name: PlumOS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Linux CFW for RG35XX and similar Allwinner devices.

operatingSystems.name: TheRA
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: RetroArch-focused Linux CFW. Supports NTFS for large ROM files.

operatingSystems.name: TrimUI OS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Stock OS for TrimUI devices (Smart Pro, Brick, etc.).

operatingSystems.name: Miyoo CFW
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Community CFW for older Miyoo devices.

operatingSystems.name: UnofficialOS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Community-maintained JELOS fork for unsupported devices.

operatingSystems.name: Simple30
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Lightweight Linux CFW for RG350/280 devices.

operatingSystems.name: NxHope
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Community Linux CFW.

operatingSystems.name: MeliOS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Linux CFW focused on performance.

operatingSystems.name: Stock (Proprietary Firmware)
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Device-specific proprietary firmware. Check manufacturer documentation.

operatingSystems.name: Stock Android
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Generic stock Android. Path locations may vary by device and Android version.

operatingSystems.name: Analogue OS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: FPGA-based system for Analogue devices (Pocket, Duo, etc.). Uses openFPGA cores.

operatingSystems.name: EmuDeck
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Emulation configuration overlay for SteamOS/Linux. Not a standalone OS.

operatingSystems.name: Bazzite
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Fedora-based gaming OS with SteamOS compatibility. Good for PC handhelds.

operatingSystems.name: ChimeraOS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Linux gaming OS for PC handhelds. Alternative to SteamOS.

operatingSystems.name: Retroid OS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Retroid's custom Android launcher/mode for their devices.

operatingSystems.name: LibreELEC
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Kodi-focused Linux OS with RetroArch addon support.

operatingSystems.name: Raspberry Pi OS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Official Raspberry Pi OS. Often used with RetroPie overlay.

operatingSystems.name: muOS
operatingSystems.formattingNotes: Linux CFW for RG35XX and similar devices. Clean UI with good performance.

operatingSystems.name: Android + EmulationStation (Standard)
operatingSystems.notes: Standard EmulationStation configuration used by most Android gaming handhelds

operatingSystems.name: RetroBat
operatingSystems.notes: Portable Windows-based EmulationStation frontend with bundled emulators. Supports both RetroArch cores and standalone emulators. Designed for plug-and-play emulation on Windows PCs.

changes: Added 'retrobat' OS entry for Windows-based EmulationStation frontend
